title: Email services in tab lose wifi connection
content:
I am having an issue with browser email services Yahoo+ and Gmail. They intermittently lose internet access, post a warning pop-up and cannot reconnect. This started with release 110 or 111 and continues through 113.0.1. I am on a Windows 10 laptop and use a T-Mobile Home Internet router. I have both email services open in tabs along with other websites which continue to access and update correctly. The situations do not happen simultaneously and the failing tab must be closed and a new tab opened for the email account. I have two instances of Firefox open. The first with tabs for the email services, plus individual tabs for Google calendar service, My Yahoo, Yahoo Finance. The second instance with tabs for My Yahoo, Start Me and various websites and search results. How and what information can I capture to identify and resolve this situation?

Thanks,

title: Secure connection failed
content:
My companies website is www.aoneengraving.com. You have been able to open it on Fire Fox for years. After Network Solutions , my provider reissued my SSL certificate you can not open it on Fire Fox. You can open it on any other browser. This is the message you get

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.aoneengraving.com. Peer’s Certificate has been revoked.

Error code: SEC_ERROR_REVOKED_CERTIFICATE 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.


Network Solutions has spent days trying to figure it out and they can not. They gave up and told me I should contact you.

This is costing me money every day it is down. I need to get it back up as quickly as possible. Can you help? Bob Monette
creator: bob345

title: High CPU Usage in a separate process in task manager
content:
I have been using firefox for more than 4 years now. But from about a year, i m facing the issue with the Sudden High CPU usage in Windows task manager.

The task manager has 2 different firefox processes. One being actual instance i am running. and the 2nd being the automatically opened in background.

i have figured out whenever i have active internet connection and my system is on charging the 2nd task automatically starts in background and uses upto 80% of cpu usage. Ending the 2nd task form task manager doesn't affect anything. only the cpu usage drops. Also Closing my firefox instance does nothing to that 2nd task.

I have tried lot of solutions i found on community. Nothing seems to help. problem still persist. I even posted comments on ongoing threads. but no reply from anywhere.

this is the last time i m trying. if i get a solution its good. otherwise i am going to shift to edge. I have no other choice.

Screenshots from multiple dates are attached.
creator: jain1998kunal

title: Pinned Pages in "New Tab" Wiped Out
content:
I recently set up a new laptop and logged into my Firefox account on it.

I noticed that the "New Tab" page didn't have my pinned tabs showing on that laptop. I didn't think much of it.

On my next reboot of my desktop, all of my pinned pages disappeared and the "New Tab" page now only shows a random collection of pages from my browser history. Is there any way at all for me to recover the list of what pages I had pinned to that "New Tab" page? I had 4 rows of 5 columns of sites pinned there, each for a reason. I know it will take me a long time to remember and restore them from memory, so I really hope there's a file somewhere to restore or at least view what they were.
creator: jffwarner0

title: Firefox "Access to the file was denied" for file on NFS volume
content:
Using Firefox to open an html file (in fact any file) on a mounted NFS volume gives an "Access to the file was denied" error. Also apparently related problem when trying to upload files from the same location to a web site, the access hangs. I have to copy the file to my local drive and upload from there. I assume these are aspects of the same issue. No problems using Chrome. 

   System details: Linux Mint 20.3 Una base: Ubuntu 20.04 focal    About Firefox: Mozilla Firefox for Linux Mint, mint-001 - 1.0

Mount point permissions look fine:

chris@Home:~$ ls -la /shared/ total 124 drwxrwxrwx 24 chris chris 4096 Feb 28 13:06 . drwxr-xr-x 21 root root 4096 Aug 6 2022 .. ...

I tried Firefox troubleshooting mode but this was no better. No other programs have a problem reading or writing to this volume, so I assume it's Firefox specific.

I read about problems with the snap package but I don't think this applies here.

I tried setting security.fileuri.strict_origin_policy to false as suggested elsewhere, to no effect.

Any ideas much appreciated!
creator: ceperman

title: Tab rearrangement after closure
content:
Hello,

I am trying to understand if there is a way to customize the tab rearranging behaviour.

In particular, the thing I find very unpractical is that, after a tab is closed, the others do rearrange, but after the mouse goes out of the tab bar. This is particularly annoying when I have to close multiple tabs, since thanks to this behaviour, the tabs which I close after the first one are always the unintended ones.

The solution would be to let the tab rearrangement happen instantly after the closure of the tab. In my opinion even without animations, I do not really care about that.

If you have any suggestions let me know.

Thanks in advance!

title: Secure Connection Failed
content:
Just sent a note, and got a response...but...you suggested this article...This article may help. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/secure-connection-failed-firefox-did-not-connect

Well, it’s nice that they have something mentioning it…but I’m not seeing any indication of a way to fix it…just a description. I already KNOW what it looks like. Like this: Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.bing.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR

Error code: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

Being as it’s EVERY stinking site, I’m not much up for trying to inform ALL the website owners…as I doubt that it’s their fault. I just want to be able to use the browser as I have for years. So far, this doesn’t solve my problem. Thanks, Ken
creator: ansilatoms

title: Everything is gone:  Settings, Add-ons, passwords....vanished.  Why do they do this when they update?
content:
Who wants to hunt down their cryptically named profile? Who knows where it is? Why put us through this? Do they enjoy aggravating their users or are they just mentally deranged? Why, why, why? Who else does this kind of idiotic behavior? I can't think of a single other program that would elect to erase all of the setup we've painstakingly done for nothing.

All I did was go to the original location to check something and clicked firefox.exe. Then Poof. Did they just do a major update recently? Like today? When it checks for updates it says its up to date but it said that a few days ago I think. Version 113.0.1. I can't even find the previous profile. I see only one file under Firefox\App\bin that says "sqlite3.exe" which I think is how they name themselves. A rational person would name it PROFILE of course. But we're in the realm of the insane.

I do see "profile" in Firefox\Data though but its filled with dozens of files. And there's no indication of any other profiles there. There are several extensions there and as mine were wiped out maybe this is the old profile?

A sensible mind would simply tell us when there's a major update and how to recover everything.
creator: moz2u

title: Can't surf the web since the last update I can recall.
